newsitem.title: HONDURAS: Honduras suggests Haitian colonel should leave.
newsitem.headline: Honduras suggests Haitian colonel should leave.

text.p: A top Honduran official on Wednesday suggested that a Haitian colonel who eluded extradition to the United States should leave this Central American country.
Col. Joseph Michel Francois was released from jail last week after the Honduran Supreme Court denied a U.S. request to extradite him on drug charges.

"It would be better if he left the country, it would be one less problem," Ramon Izaguirre, the Honduran vice minister of the interior, told reporters. The interior ministry is responsible for internal security and immigration matters.
Francois, a leader in the 1991-94 military government that stepped down under threat of a U.S. invasion, took up refuge in Honduras last year after spending time in the Dominican Republic.
He was arrested by Honduran authorities on March 7 on a U.S. request. Washington alleges Francois ran a cocaine trafficking network from Port-au-Prince while he was police chief there.
